oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Breeding the Red-Crested Cardinal
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: LaRue, Chris
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A pair of Red-Crested Cardin als (Faroariacoronata) at the Topeka ZoologicalPark have reproduced two years in a rowin the large free flight Tropical RainForest exhibit. The exhibit is a circu larstructure 100 feet in diameter coveredwith a geodesic dome 3 I feet high in thecenter. The dome is made of clear acrylicpanels which allow 92% natural lighttransmission. The building is maintainedat a temperature of 70° to 90°F and at70% to 80% relative humidity . The interiorof the exhibit contains a lush growthof tropical plants with trees 20-25 feettall .
